title: General
description: General requirements for Food Safety Plan including team formation, leadership assignment, training documentation, product descriptions, and process flow diagrams

requirements.question: Is there a team responsible for the Food Safety Plan at the operation, with a leader assigned for the development, implementation and on-going maintenance of the Food Safety Plan?
Is there documented evidence that the food safety team members have been trained on Food Safety Plan development?
Does a product description exist for the products produced?
Has the process(es) been flow diagrammed in sufficient detail to completely describe the process or product handling/processing steps?

capaInject: Establish corrective actions when Food Safety Plan team lacks Preventive Controls Qualified Individual requiring certification training or consultant engagement
Implement procedures for updating team member training when new preventive controls are implemented or regulatory requirements change
Develop action plans when product descriptions omit critical food safety information requiring comprehensive review and hazard reassessment
Create preventive measures to ensure process flow diagrams are maintained current and verified whenever processing changes occur
Implement verification procedures confirming leadership assignment and ongoing responsibilities for Food Safety Plan maintenance and effectiveness
traceabilityInject: Maintain Food Safety Plan team documentation including qualifications, PCQI certification, assigned responsibilities, and leadership structure
Keep training records for all team members documenting preventive controls coursework, completion dates, and continuing education
Retain comprehensive product descriptions including formulations, processing parameters, packaging specifications, and intended consumer use
Document detailed process flow diagrams showing all handling and processing steps with decision points and control measure locations identified
Archive flow diagram verification records including on-site confirmation dates, process observations, necessary modifications, and approval signatures
micro_inject: Inadequate Food Safety Plan team training results in failure to identify Listeria monocytogenes environmental contamination risks in ready-to-eat operations
Missing PCQI oversight allows insufficient preventive controls for pathogenic E. coli in raw agricultural commodities destined for fresh consumption
Incomplete product descriptions fail to recognize pH and water activity factors that control Clostridium botulinum growth in packaged products
Insufficient process flow detail misses cross-contamination points where Salmonella transfers from raw to cooked products through shared equipment
Lack of designated leadership for Food Safety Plan maintenance results in outdated controls that fail to address emerging pathogen risks
